content.p: The Freedom of Information Act (FOI) gives you the right to ask public authorities (including Universities) for information they hold. Access to information helps the public make public authorities accountable for their actions and allows public debate to be better informed and more productive. The University Of Nottingham will ensure that the service it provides for those wishing to gain access to information is simple, efficient, and effective. The Publication Scheme provides an overview of information the University already makes available. The University Publication Scheme is issued in line with the model publication scheme for Higher Education, issued by the Information Commissioner's Office. Our FAQs provide information about how to make a valid FOI request as well as what information is available through our Publication Scheme Make an FOI Request Requests for personal information under GDPR/Data Protection Act Forms and Information Sheets Disclosure Log Trent Building University of Nottingham University Park Nottingham, NG7 2RD telephone: +44 115 951 5761 fax: +44 115 951 5739 email: registrars@nottingham.ac.uk
